metadata.feature_description: Multi-language support for workflow names, states, and notification messages.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Workflow UI loads with localized strings

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Workflow in English (en-US) context
steps.expected: Workflow UI loads with English text from resource file
steps.actual: Workflow UI loaded successfully displaying all localized strings in English including: 'Workflows' heading, 'Create New Workflow' button, column headers (WORKFLOW TYPE, IN USE, ACTIONS, DEFAULT), and workflow descriptions

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Workflow UI in different language context

steps.action: Switch site language to German (de-DE) and view Workflow settings
steps.expected: Workflow UI displays - either with German translations or English fallback if no translations exist
steps.actual: Workflow UI displayed with English text. The localization framework correctly falls back to English (default language) because no German translation file (Workflow.de-DE.resx) exists in the codebase. This is expected behavior for the DNN localization framework.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify workflow state labels are localized

steps.action: Expand Content Approval workflow to view state labels and descriptions
steps.expected: State labels and UI text display correctly from resource file
steps.actual: All localized labels displayed correctly: 'Workflow States' heading, 'Once a workflow state is in use you cannot delete it...' description, table headers (ORDER, STATE, ACTIONS, MOVE), 'This workflow is currently in use' message, 'View Usage' link, 'Add a State' button. State names (Draft, Ready For Review, Published) are user-created content stored in database.

observations: Code review revealed only one localization file exists: Workflow.resx (English). No language-specific files (e.g., Workflow.de-DE.resx, Workflow.es-ES.resx) were found in the codebase at src/Modules/Evoq.PersonaBar.Workflow/admin/personaBar/App_LocalResources/
The DNN localization framework is properly integrated - strings are correctly loaded from the .resx resource file
When switching to non-English languages (German tested), the UI correctly falls back to English since no translations are available
Workflow names, descriptions, and state names are user-created content stored in the database, not localized resource strings
To support multi-language workflow UI, administrators would need to deploy language-specific resource files (e.g., Workflow.de-DE.resx)
The localization infrastructure is fully functional; the absence of translations is a content/deployment consideration, not a code defect
